proverb: Man wey naked no dey put hand for pocket.
moral: You can’t do somethings if there's are no certain conditions.

proverb: Chicken wey run way from borno go Ibadan go still end up inside  pot of soup.
moral: You can’t run away from your destiny.

proverb: Today’s newspaper na tomorrow suya wrap.
moral: Keep calm, nothing last forever.

proverb: Cow wey dey in a hurry to go America go come back as corn beef.
moral: Just be patient, let the game come to you. Don’t rush.

proverb: Akara and moin moin get the same parent na wetin dey pass through make dem diffrent.
moral: How you start doesn’t matter, what matters is how you finish.

proverb: To piss no hard but fowl no fit.
moral: It’s easy doesn’t mean everyone can do it.

proverb: No matter how dark room wan be, man go still locate woman breast.
moral: There is always a way when something matters much.

proverb: Custard na just pap wey jand.
moral: Appearances are often misleading. – Looks are decieving.

proverb: Wetin concern agbero with twitter handle or malu with face cap?
moral: Mind your business.

proverb: If life dey show you pepper my guy make pepper soup.
moral: Make something good out of a bad experience.

proverb: I get am before no be property
moral: Stop living in the past and start living in the present.

proverb: If person too tey for party e go follow dem wash plate.
moral: Don’t outstay your welcome.

proverb: Rolling stone, of course na person push am now.
moral: There is always a reason for something.

proverb: Craze no hard to form, na the trekking be wahala.
moral: Easier said than done.

proverb: No matter how hot your tempa be, e no fit  boil beans.
moral: Calm down, your temper won’t solve the problem.

proverb: Every mallam with im own kettle, every aboki with im own radio.
moral: Every man for himself.

proverb: You no need cutlery to chop slap.
moral: Embarrassing situation happens without ones permission.

proverb: Opolo eye no be open eye.
moral: Having Big eyes doesn’t make you civilised.

proverb: Leave matter for Mathias and Sabi for Sabinus.
moral: Let sleeping dog lie.

proverb: Bring suya, bring suya…. na cow body dey suffer am.
moral: Every action has a consequence.

proverb: E go better na e go better, na im make ibo man still dey Kano.
moral: When there is hope, there is life.

proverb: Escort me, escort me, na im slave trade take start.
moral: Serious things sometimes start like joke.

proverb: Na from play play dem dey form PLAYER.
moral: Serious things sometimes start like joke.

proverb: Pikin wen use agbada take start guy go talk wetin e go wear wen e old.
moral: Slow and steady wins the race.

proverb: The water wey dem use take make eba no go even come back.
moral: Don’t cry over spilt milk.

proverb: Nearly no dey kill bird.
moral: It’s  either you have it or you don’t.

proverb: Fly wey no get special adviser na im dey folow dead body enter grave.
moral: Don’t stay ignorant, a word is enough for the wise.

proverb: No matter how lizard dey do press up e no go get chest like aligator.
moral: Be proud of who you are.

proverb: The cassava today fit be garri tomorrow.
moral: No condition is permanent.

proverb: If mad man don beat ur mama before, if she see mechanic she go run.
moral: Once beaten twice shy.

proverb: Jollof rice wey dey for the bottom of pot today, go dey for top of cooler tommorow.
moral: No condition is permanent.

proverb: Fowl wey they carry for head no dey know say to waka na work.
moral: A dependent would not know the value of what he/she is enjoying.

proverb: Na from clap dance dey start.
moral: Big thing don’t happen suddenly.

proverb: Cockroach wey dey form swagger, if e summersault reach fowl place im no go leave to tell him story.
moral: Know your boundaries.

proverb: Person wey borrow cloth go party, no dey dance too much.
moral: Learn to use other people's things carefully.

proverb: Who read na im serious, who pass na im know book.
moral: People only care about the successful ones.

proverb: weda nyansh face east or west, na still back e go dey.
moral: Somethings in life can be changed.

proverb: The fly wey perch on top butter think say im be butterfly.
moral: Be realistic, don't deceive yourself.

proverb: A bird in hand, na better suya be that.
moral: Make do of your current situation.

proverb: Pikin wey say him mama no go sleep, na orphanage home fit am.
moral: Value what you have while you still have it.

proverb: The journey of a thousand miles, beta make u go airport go take flight.
moral: Don't give yourself unnecessary stress.

proverb: The difference between kpekere and plantain chips na packaging.
moral: Don’t judge based on appearance alone.

proverb: Wetin you dey find for sokoto dey for shokoto.
moral: The grass is not always greener on the other side.

proverb: Better soup na money kill am.
moral: Luxury isn’t cheap. The good things in life don’t come cheap.

proverb: Pikin wey say im mama no go sleep, no go sleep too.
moral: If you ferment trouble, you will also be a partaker of the trouble.

proverb: No matter how tall Okra grow e no go tall pass im owner.
moral: No servant is greater than his or her master.

proverb: One day, breeze go blow and fowl yansh go open.
moral: Nothing can remain hidden forever, the truth always comes out.

proverb: E don tey wey nyash dey for back.
moral: There is nothing new under the sun.

proverb: Monkey no dey born fowl.
moral: Like begets like.

proverb: Cunny man die, cunny man bury am.
moral: It takes a thief to catch a thief.

proverb: Everybody answer your papa surname.
moral: Speak for yourself alone.

proverb: Na condition make crayfish bend.
moral: When one is forced to do the unthinkable in certain circumstances.

proverb: The difference between puff-puff and doughnut na packaging.
moral: Don't judge based on appearance alone.

proverb: No be today yansh dey back.
moral: The more things change, the more they remain the same.

proverb: At all, at all na winsh.
moral: Half bread is better than none.

proverb: At all, at all na im bad pass.
moral: Half a loaf is better than none.

proverb: Who no go, no know.
moral: Experience is the best teacher.

proverb: No be the way dem take dey drink water dem dey drink pepper soup.
moral: Adapt your plans to new situations.

proverb: Who dey cry dey see road.
moral: Use common sense even in sorrow.

proverb: I no gree, I no gree na im dey tear trouser.
moral: Avoid conflict from the beginning, know when to let go.

proverb: Na cooperation make rice dey full pot.
moral: You can achieve more with team work.

proverb: "Feel at home" na im dey make visitor spoil TV remote.
moral: Don't be too comfortable to the extent of fiddling with other people's property.

proverb: Small pikin wey talk say e go shake iroko tree, na im head e go shake.
moral: Know  your limits.

proverb: Who get big teeth must get big mouth to cover am.
moral: Be ready to solve your own problem.

proverb: Na person wey leave door open na im goat dey enter im house go sleep
moral: People below you will naturally take advantage of you if you leave the opportunity.

proverb: Awoof dey run belle.
moral: Be contented with what you have.

proverb: Na where dey pain person, na im person dey put for near fire.
moral: Justifying drastic action. Take whatever action necessary to resolve an issue.

proverb: Until man marry new wife, im no go know say d first wife na angel.
moral: The grass is not always greener on the other side.

proverb: If person too tay for toilet, im go forget say shit dey smell.
moral: When doing something, don't waste time beyond necessary.

proverb: Person no dey break glass for party wey dem no invite am
moral: Advice – do not draw attention to yourself in unfamiliar surroundings.

proverb: You fit give coat to house boy make im wear... but houseboy go always be houseboy.
moral: You can't make a silk purse out of a sow's ear.

proverb: Everyday for thief, one day for the owner
moral: Bad deeds will always be exposed... someday, sometime.

proverb: Fine girl be like flower, everybody want am. If im no quick choose, im beauty go fade and nobody go want am.
moral: It is best to strike while the iron is hot.

proverb: If girl take husband do boyfriend, she go take boyfriend do husband.
moral: Strike while the iron is hot.

proverb: No mata how im pain person, person no fit cry follow dead body enta grave.
moral: No matter how painful the situation is, life goes on

proverb: Wen pikin start to shout for him papa back.... You go don know say im don dey do the tin wey papa and mama dey do.
moral: Sudden bad behaviour from a child is likely to be as a result of deeper issues.

proverb: Dem no dey tell old person say im mouth dey smell.
moral: Always respect your elders.

proverb: Oba no dey go transfer.
moral: One’s birth right is not transferrable.

proverb: Dirty water dey quench fire.
moral: A drowning man will clutch at straw.

proverb: Water no get enemy.
moral: Acceptance! Some things do not need much deliberation.

proverb: Old man wey dey carry small girl no suppose complain when the girl slap am for public.
moral: Familiarity breeds contempt.

proverb: Farmer wey sleep for planting season go surely hungry wen harvest come.
moral: Failure to plan is planning to fail.

proverb: Person wey born pikin dey still chop.
moral: The responsibilities that come with parenthood should not stop the parents from having a life.

proverb: Na who know man dey kill man.
moral: Caution, those closest to you are more likely to hurt you.

proverb: Body no be firewood.
moral: Humans have feelings and limits.

proverb: If you comot your eye make you for no see your enemy, how you go see your friend?
moral: Do not cut off your nose to spite your face.

proverb: Cow wey no get tail... Na God dey drive fly for am.
moral: God helps the helpless.

proverb: The person wey borrow you trouser go always dey look your waist.
moral: Better be a lender than a borrower.

proverb: Na coconut tree wey fall, na im make goat fit climb am.
moral: The downfall of great man is what gave power to the weak.

proverb: If you no let people laff u, dem go cry for you.
moral: Don't be afraid to take action because others might mock you.

proverb: No be how bodi dey scratch person na im person dey scratch am.
moral: Calm down and think rationally. Easy does it.

proverb: When two elephants fights, na ground dey suffer am.
moral: Warning – when the powerful fight, it is the powerless that suffers.

proverb: The person wey shit for ground fit forget but the person wey pack the shit no go ever forget.
moral: Only the ungrateful forgets.

proverb: Pikin wey no listen to im elders go use basket fetch water from river one day.
moral: A stubborn child who ignores elders’ advice will regret it in future.

proverb: Dem no dey tell blind man say market don close, by the time im no hear voices, im go know.
moral: A dog will always find its way home.

proverb: Na who marry cripple, know as im dey sleep with am.
moral: Where there’s a will, there’s a way.

proverb: Dough must enter fire before e rise.
moral: Nothing ventured, nothing gained.

proverb: My own, you own and our own different.
moral: To each his own.

proverb: If you sabi pound, pound for mortal, if not.... pound for floor.
moral: Achieve your goal – by whatever means neccessary.

proverb: Monkey dey work, baboon dey chop.
moral: The poor work, the rich eat.

proverb: If you beat pikin with your left hand, make you use your right hand draw am near.
moral: Temper justice with mercy.

proverb: River wey forget im source dey dry.
moral: Dont forget those you met on your way up because you might meet them on your way down.

proverb: Monkey no fine but im mama like am.
moral: Love is blind, a mother's love is unconditional.

proverb: Shine your eye no be curse.
moral: Dont take offence at being told to get street-smart.

proverb: Na who look new wife eye, na im know say she dey cry.
moral: Soldiering on in the face of distractions

proverb: Khaki no be Leather.
moral: All fingers are not equal.

proverb: No use shame chop poison.
moral: One shouldn't be afraid to take action because others might mock you, you might end up worse off.

proverb: Water don pass garri.
moral: Referring to a situation that has spiraled out of control.

proverb: Na the name wey dem give dog, na im the dog dey answer.
moral: Whoever pays the piper, dictates the tune.

proverb: First to do no dey pain.
moral: Revenge is a dish best served cold.

proverb: Rice wey dem chop remain give you betta pass the rice wey never done.
moral: Make use of the available opportunity given to you.

proverb: Person way dey sell egg, no day start fight for market.
moral: A person who lives in glass house don’t throw stones.

proverb: Na the small cooperation wey water and garri get na im make am dey rise.
moral: There’s strength in Unity

proverb: Na person wey no know him mother boyfriend dey call am uncle.
moral: Knowledge is power.

proverb: Ogogoro and water get the same colour but no be the same taste.
moral: Appearance might be deceiving

proverb: Person wey use Elephant set trap, na him know wetin he wan Catch.
moral: Everything in life has it’s limits

proverb: Its a small world!! No mean say you fit trek from Naija go London
moral: Be realistic, things are not always as easy as they sound.

proverb: Person wey don faint before no be stranger to death.
moral: Sometimes just a little experience is enough to learn.

proverb: Na for old age ashawo dey know the value of pikin.
moral: You might not realize the value of something until it's too late.

proverb: Na who blow dust, dust dey follow.
moral: Envy and jealousy have repercussions.

proverb: Woman wey never see problem na im dey still hold breast run.
moral: Seriousness can be judged from your actions.

proverb: Woman wey dey find pikin no dey wear pant sleep.
moral: Certain actions are required in certain situation.

proverb: Rat wey follow lizard enter rain, na later im go hear am.
moral: Know you limit; know who you hang out with.

proverb: Na for afternoon dem dey find black goat.
moral: There's time for everything.

proverb: Weather hot, e no mean say fowl go lay boiled egg.
moral: No matter how bad a situation is, it's never unheard of.

proverb: Pikin wey him mama back cross water, wey say him march fish, wetin him mama go march?
moral: Always learn to appreciate people especially does helping you.

proverb: Small pikin wey dem carry for back no know say the journey far.
moral: The dependent ones might not appreciate the benefits of what they are getting.

proverb: Person wey chop belle full, no know wetin hungry man dey see.
moral: The fortunate ones might not understand the pain others are going through.

proverb: Lizard wey fall from tall iroko tree, if nobody hail am!! im go hail himself.
moral: Learn to appreciate yourself.

proverb: Cockroach wey jam fowl, jam bad luck.
moral: Know your boundaries to avoid delicate situation.

proverb: Pikin wey say him mama no fine they use style call him papa blind man.
moral: Be mindful of what you say, you might just be insulting yourself indirectly.

proverb: No be eye wey dem take chop eba dem take dey share meat.
moral: Certain situation warrant seriousness.

proverb: Dem no dey tell tortoise say race don start.
moral: Don't bother wasting your time with unproductive people.

proverb: If pikin say he sabi die, him papa sef go tell am say him sabi bury.
moral: Don't be a huge burden to your parent.

proverb: Na wetin dey sweet for goat mouth, na im dey kill am.
moral: Excess od everything is bad.

proverb: If e be like say everybody dey craze, na you dey craze.
moral: You might be your own problem, learn to be nice to people.

proverb: Meat wey you dey forbid, no use your teeth cut am.
moral: Don't start what you can finish.

proverb: My thing and our thing no be the same.
moral: We are all different

proverb: Na happiness dey make prick stand.
moral: Good mood influences ones action.

proverb: Person wey dey purge no dey select toilet.
moral: There's no time for delay in urgent times.

proverb: Na See-Finish make “Good morning” turn “How far”.
moral: Disrespect can be painful.

proverb: No be today yansh don get center parting.
moral: There's nothing new under the sun.

proverb: Ikebe no dey heavy the owner.
moral: You should be in the position to solve your own problems.

proverb: Na when rain stop you go know say Umbrella na load.
moral: Nothing is perfect, everything as it time.

proverb: Anywhere wey belle face na front.
moral: Because your Indomie quick done no mean say who cook beans lazy.

proverb: Just because you are fortunate enough to be successful doesn't mean others aren't making effort.
moral: Remember say this life na “Standing fan” if he blow you small, e go blow another person.

proverb: Every man as is time.
moral: Pikin fit play with him mama breasts but e no fit try am with him Papa Kponranran.

proverb: There's a boundary to everything.
moral: Egg Roll wey no get egg na Puff-puff.

proverb: If it's not good enough, it's not good enough.
moral: Wetin old person siddon for ground see, pikin wey stand on top tree no go ever fit see am.

proverb: Na wen visitor chop finish for your house im dey remember say rain done fall finish.
moral: Respect your elderly ones, they probably have more experience than you do.

proverb: Wetin concern bicycle with filling station.
moral: Don't bother about other people's problem.

proverb: Poor man no dey siddon for bench for village meeting.
moral: In life, there's heirachy.

proverb: Dem no dey slim fit borrowed clothes.
moral: You don't mess with other people's properties.

proverb: Good name better pass gold and silver.
moral: Try to always make people know you for good.

proverb: Becos native doctor go London no mean say the gods don begin speak English.
moral: It's not a matter of how far, it's how well.

proverb: If you like wear monkey suit come carry am go London, banana go still disgrace am.
moral: You can never change a man from his original ways.

proverb: Na the same hot water wey dey make egg hard, na im dey make yam soft.
moral: Different stroke for different folks.

proverb: Becos lizard dey nod im head no mean say everytin dey ok.
moral: Avoid making assumptions about people.

proverb: No be everytin wey touch your hand you go put for mouth.
moral: Be careful and mind your ways.

proverb: Epp me beat my pikin no mean kill am for me.
moral: There's a limit to everything.

proverb: I hear no mean say i gree.
moral: Silence doesn't mean acceptance.

proverb: No be who first carri belle dey born boy.
moral: It's not a matter of how far but how well.

proverb: Shift make i siddon, na im dey collect person space.
moral: Render favour carefully.

proverb: Pikin no sabi say fire dey burn person until im touch am.
moral: Experience is the best teacher.

proverb: Pesin wey won catch animal for bush no dey blow whistle.
moral: Certain actions requires certain measures.

proverb: Pikin wey no sabi medicine dey call am vegetable.
moral: Knowledge is power, don't be ignorant.

proverb: No be who first call Police dey win case.
moral: There's hierarchy in life, it's not a matter of how far but how well.

proverb: E no get as e be wey e never be before.
moral: There's nothing new under the sun.

proverb: This one good, this one good... na im make madman carry plenty load.
moral: Be contempted with what you have.

proverb: Wen money dey, friends go dey... wen money go, friends go go.
moral: Not everyone stick around in time of trouble.

proverb: Cow wey no get tail... na God dey help am pursue fly.
moral: God is always there for the needy.

proverb: Dem no dey tell blind man sey rain dey fall.
moral: You are in the best position to advise yourself.

proverb: Pastor wen dey pray for mad pesin no dey close eye.
moral: Take precautions when taking drastic actions.

proverb: I no be your mate. Na im make slippers get size.
moral: There's hierarchy in life.

proverb: Na economy recession make teacher use ruler dey measure yam.
moral: There's a reason for every actions.

proverb: Water wey dey hot fit later cold... No rush life.
moral: No condition is permanent, don't rush life.

proverb: Person wey too dey sleep na poverty go hit am.
moral: There's no food for lazy the mind.

proverb: Dangote, Dangote, Dangote still dey find money o.
moral: Money is an insatiable need.

proverb: Dem no dey tell deaf man say war don start.
moral: You are in the right position to advise yourself.

proverb: If you no get money, no hide your face. Show your face make somebody help you.
moral: Share your problems, in order to be able to get help.

proverb: Na person wey never see problem dey use English dey pray.
moral: Don't take serious matters with levity.

proverb: Nothing concern bicycle wit fuel scarcity.
moral: Don't bother with things that doesn't concern you.

proverb: Na over confidence make February no complete.
moral: Overconfidence can be disastrously.

proverb: Goat wey get mind follow lion go catch fish, make e know say weda dem catch fish or not, Lion food don set.
moral: Beware of who you hang out with.

proverb: Wetin concern dog wit family planning?
moral: Don't bother yourself with problems that doesn't exist

proverb: Pikin wey go strong go strong... No be until dem name am Samson.
moral: It not just about effort, grace is also important.

proverb: Make I chop this guy money, Make I chop this guy money, Na so ashawo dey take start.
moral: Serious problems start gradually.

proverb: Cos Lion dey sick no mean say im and cat be mate.
moral: The downfall of a man is not the end of a man.

proverb: E go beta, e go beta, na im make camel still dey carry load.
moral: Ones there's life, there's hope.

proverb: Na determination dey make Okada dey overtake Trailer for road.
moral: Think properly before taking drastic actions.

proverb: First class no be who collect extra sheet.
moral: It's not a matter of how far but how well.

proverb: Even ice cream truck dey announce with jingle bell from far.
moral: You got to voice out yourself for you to be heard.

proverb: No be who carry first be the most intelligent.
moral: It's not about how far but how well.

proverb: Food wey your family go eat no go make you poor.
moral: Family comes first, always take care of your family.

proverb: Never get in a mud fight with a pig. When una turn brown with dirty, na two pig everybody go see.
moral: You can't bring an ignorant down without going down with him.

proverb: 20 pikin no fit play together for 20 years.
moral: Not one is meant to be together forever.

proverb: A stitch in time... dey prevent further tear tear.
moral: Prevention is better than cure.

proverb: Person wey get one leg no dey answer "no shaking".
moral: Know your limit.

proverb: Dog wey go lost, no go hear hunter whistle.
moral: To forewarned is to forearmed.

proverb: Dem no dey put hand for pocket climb ladder.
moral: Don't take things with levity.

proverb: Pastor wey no get money to buy gold necklace for him wife, go say all na vanity.
moral: Financial situation can influence one's attitude.

proverb: Burger no fit tell Eba how banga soup dey be.
moral: Everyone has his or her field of professionalism.

proverb: Everybody na thief, na the person wey dem catch be 'barawo'.
moral: Nobody is a saint.

proverb: Na when rain fall, okada owner go know say him no be big man.
moral: Everyone definitely has a flaw.

proverb: Na when soldier slap you, you go sabi say police na your friend.
moral: Experience is the best teacher.

proverb: If you take cow eye take dey look life, na only grass you go dey see.
moral: Experiences are different, do not generalize.

proverb: Na sofry sofry dem dey take kill fly wey perch on top brokos.
moral: Certain situations requires skill not strength.

proverb: Any girl wey no get breast, na her papa she take chest resemble.
moral: Let's call a spade a spade.

proverb: No matter how you get money reach, you no fit buy yesterday.
moral: Money can't buy everything.

proverb: Na from 'give me my cap, give me my cap' pikin dey take touch him papa bald head.
moral: Act maturely to avoid disrespect.

proverb: When Garri see wetin hot, e change e name to Eba.
moral: Change is constant.

proverb: Head wey no wan think go carry load.
moral: If education is expensive, try ignorance.

proverb: Forget Trust! If trust dey, water nor for boil Fish.
moral: Beware of who you trust.

proverb: No food for lazy man no be for pesin wey im mama dey sell food.
moral: Some people are born fortunate.

proverb: Who dey hold landlord rentage no dey fry stew way curry dey.
moral: Always strive to pay your debt.

proverb: Wen goat laff cos say him hear say Lion dey come, you need find out wich kind grass im dey chop.
moral: If you fear danger, you act safely.

proverb: Headmaster was once a school boy.
moral: Everyone has a humble beginning.

proverb: We no go kneel down beg cow because we wan chop meat.
moral: Don't belittle yourself because of materialistic things.

proverb: Garri no get advert; yet it sell pass Indomie for market.
moral: A good name might be all you need to succeed.

proverb: Dead person no dey hide for the person wey won baff am.
moral: Don't hide your problems from people that can help you to solve them.

proverb: Person when never go another person papa farm dey say na im papa own big pass.
moral: You are limited by your own experience.

proverb: U belle full today no mean sey u no go hungry tomorrow.
moral: All days can't be the same, save for days you won't have much on you.

proverb: Hunter wey carry goat come house na thief.
moral: Don't be greedy; don't go beyond your limit.

proverb: Trouble dey sleep... yanga dey wake am.
moral: Avoid causing trouble.

proverb: Person wey open eye cut shaki from pepper soup is scared of nothing.
moral: Only the brave take bold steps.

proverb: Table no dey turn, na who get sense dey change him chair.
moral: Always apply reasoning, things are not always as they appear.

proverb: “Monkey smart, monkey smart”, na because tree near tree.
moral: It's not just about skills, you might just be fortunate.

proverb: Who dey argue with king, na him dey tey for kneel down.
moral: Respect those that are superior to you.

proverb: No matter how fly craze reach, e no fit perch on top hot eba.
moral: Know your limit.

proverb: Belle no be show glass, na who vomit, go show wetin him chop.
moral: Hunan being are dynamic, know who you trust.

proverb: One day, monkey go go market, e no go return.
moral: There's always an end game for the evil ones.

proverb: Village wey the only barber na lion, all the goats there go keep afro.
moral: Don't dangerous times, you take strict measures.

proverb: Respect who get, but fear who never collect.
moral: Always play safe when dealing with people.

proverb: Pesin wey use him head break coconut no go chop from am.
moral: Avoid doing something deadly.

proverb: I no fit climb, na bottom tree them dey talk am.
moral: The lazy one's will always find excuses.

proverb: To give monkey banana no be issue but na to collect am back be wahala.
moral: Be careful about who you entrust things to.
